ListViewChartInstance.name: ListViewChartInstance
ListViewChartInstance.description: Retrieves metadata for all standard and custom charts for a given entity in context of a given list view.

AggregateField.description: The field that’s used for calculating data on each group. AggregateField can’t be the same as GroupingField.

AggregateType.description: The type of calculations to run on each group. The supported AggregateType values are Count, Sum, and Avg.

ChartType.description: The type of chart to create. The supported chart types are horizontal bar chart, vertical bar chart, and donut chart.

DataQuery.description: The SOQL query that can be executed to fetch the data for drawing a chart.

DataQueryWithoutUserFilters.description: The SOQL query that can be executed to fetch the data for drawing a chart, without user filters.

DeveloperName.description: API name of the chart. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. In managed packages, this field prevents naming conflicts on package installations. With this field, a developer can change the object’s name in a managed package and the changes are reflected in a subscriber’s organization. Note When creating large sets of data, always specify a unique DeveloperName for each record. If no DeveloperName is specified, performance slows down while Salesforce generates one for each record.

GroupingField.description: The field that’s used to divide the data into collections. The field has to be supported by SOQL GROUP BY functionality. GroupingField can’t be the same as AggregateField.

IsDeletable.description: Indicates if the chart can be deleted.

IsEditable.description: Indicates if the chart can be edited. Standard charts are not editable.

IsLastViewed.description: Indicates if a chart is the last viewed by a user.

Label.description: The display name of the chart.

ListViewChartId.description: ID of the chart created by a user. For standard charts, this is null.

ListViewContextId.description: ID of the list view in context of which the chart is generated. Required to query ListViewChartInstance.

SourceEntity.description: API name of the entity to which the chart is related. Required to query ListViewChartInstance.
